hierarchy.entry_domain: Data Protection and Information Lifecycle Management

active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate: Should companies always grant the Right to be Forgotten (Erasure), even if it conflicts with public interest or legal obligations? Use real-world examples like the Google Spain case and evaluate arguments from both data subject privacy and organizational accountability perspectives.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Data Subject Rights (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance > Data Protection and Information Lifecycle Management > Data Classification and Handling > Data Subject Rights). Use the provided learning objectives (spanning Bloom's REMEMBER to CREATE), active learning activities, and 4 scaffolding layers to generate high-quality, optimized flashcards. Content must be complete: Cover all 8 GDPR rights fully (Informed, Access, Rectification, Erasure/'Forgotten', Restriction [disputed accuracy, unlawful pending investigation, objection pending], Portability, Object, Automated Decisions/Profiling). Include definitions (Data Subject, Personal Data, Processing, Controller, Processor). Emphasize implementation (1-month timelines, verification), integration (CCPA comparisons, automation). Follow the exact flashcard schema: Generate 40-50 cards balanced by layers/types. Use distractor protocol for MCQs. Ensure measurable, active recall. Incorporate active learning (e.g., scenario cards from problem-solving). Output as JSON array of objects: [{'type': 'MCQ', 'front': '...', 'back': {...}, 'layer': '1', 'blooms_level': 'REMEMBER', 'hierarchy': 'Full path'}]. Prioritize university pedagogy: Scaffolding progression, voter consensus (82.9% approval), web-grounded accuracy.
